palpitations past medical history she has hypertension and pulmonary sarcoid which she has been taking prednisone ten milligrams daily for twenty five years she also takes lisinopril ten milligrams daily she has no known drug allergies past surgical history she just had a cardiac cath one year ago vitals everything is fine except for heart rate which is at one ten blood pressure one thirty six over ninety nine and spo two at ninety one which is a little bit low family history mother died of a sudden sudden death at four years old and father died of a mi at fifty nine there's no permanent there's chest discomfort and flutters which are chest which are cardiac palpitations and there's presyncopy symptoms which she said were shortness of breath and tiredness so for cvs she had discomfort palpitations and presyncope symptoms pulmonary severe symptoms she had wheezing and dyspnea and also orthopnea physical exam showed overall she looks fatigued no carotid bruvies but we did find jvd there's a murmur present in the heart when i was doing a heart exam there was wheezing and rales during the lung lung exam as well pulses were equal but her leg did have edema we went over the lab test with her and chest x-ray showed there was some pulmonary edema and cardiomegaly but most noticeably there is a sign which is indicative of sarcoidosis echo showed restrictive cardiomyopathy with increased wall thickness and also a dilated atrium ejection fraction was at fifty five percent ekg showed nonsustained ventricular tachycardia troponin was within normal limits but the labs that were high were bnp at four thousand so after talking to the patient getting her history review systems physical exam and lab tests she she was diagnosed with sarcoidosis cardiac sarcoidosis so she had sarcoidosis restrictive cardiomyopathy of new york heart association criteria three i've talked with miss palmer and she was admitted to a telemetry in serious condition orders were vitals every two hours she wanted to get out of bed there was out of bed assistance strict io daily weights maintain o two at ninety six i know hers is at ninety one right now there was an order for dvt prophylaxis keep veins open kbo and also just put her on a low sodium diet the meds that were ordered for her was to be kept on lisinopril that she's already taking ten milligrams once a day up the dose of prednisone to sixty milligrams a day for her now cardiac sarcoidosis before it was the ten milligrams for the pulmonary sarcoidosis so yeah so up the prednisone dose to sixty milligrams and also add one hundred fifty milligrams of iv amiodarone for her arrhythmia the non sustained ventricular tachycardia and also forty grams of furosemide iv was ordered for her as a follow-up to admit she was
